word: THE READER WILL OBSERVE THAT THE E. G. WHITE DIARY ENTRIES ARE RECORDED IN TERSE DIARY STYLE, SOMETIMES IN SHORT PHRASES AND OFTEN IN THE PRESENT TENSE. SURELY IT WILL BE ALSO RECOGNIZED THAT THE PURELY BIOGRAPHICAL ACCOUNT AS ELLEN WHITE RECORDED HER DAY-BY-DAY ACTIVITIES DOES NOT CONSTITUTE INSTRUCTION FOR THE CHURCH AND THEREFORE IS NOT TO BE CONSIDERED AS AUTHORITATIVE TESTIMONY. THIS IS TRUE ALSO OF BIOGRAPHICAL REFERENCES DRAWN FROM THE E. G. WHITE LETTERS. NEVERTHELESS, THE EXAMPLE OF ELLEN WHITE DOES ADD EMPHASIS TO HER PRECEPT.
